title: Australians urged to give blood following mass shooting at Bondi | ABC NEWS
description: Lifeblood Australia has issued an urgent call out for blood donations, especially type O negative. Since the callout, over 20,000 blood donation appointments have been made, making it the largest community response since the 2009 Black Saturday fires.  Reporting by Amal Wehbe, ABC News Social Media team.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Two gunmen take aim at a Jewish festival, killing 15 people and injuring dozens | ABC NEWS
description: Sydney's Jewish community, and the country, are trying to process the horror that unfolded at Bondi Beach. Fifteen people were killed in the terrorist attack. One of the gunmen is also dead. The other, his son, is in a critical condition. The nation's leaders are calling this mass murder an "attack on Australia itself". title: IN FULL: Bondi Beach Terror Attack Special (may contain distressing content) | ABC NEWS
description: Watch a one-hour special from ABC NEWS and 730 covering the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, in which 15 people were killed. Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-12-15/bondi-beach-shooting-terrorist-attack/106142446  00:00 - Special coverage of the Bondi Beach terror attack. 01:10 - Two gunmen kill 15 and injure dozens in a targeted attack on a Jewish festival. 06:08 - Nick Dole reports from Bondi Pavilion where mourners gather. 07:16 - Victims of the attack identified, including a 10-year-old girl. 09:40 - Pablo Viñales with an update from St Vincent's Hospital in Sydney. 10:43 - Bondi's Jewish community grapples with fear after the attack. 13:03 - Fiona Willan at the Chabad of Bondi where the Jewish community grieves. 13:54 - What is known about the father and son behind the attack. 16:28 - Parents of man who disarmed an attacker praise their son's heroic act. 18:52 - Albanese moves swiftly on gun laws as pressure builds over rising antisemitism. 21:37 - David Speers with analysis on the prime minister's position. 23:01 - Global Jewish diaspora grieves in solidarity with Bondi. 25:11 - Mazoe Ford in Jerusalem where Israeli citizens and officials react. 26:16 - Tom Saunders with the weather report. 28:48 - Nick Dole on the community impact of the traumatic attack. 29:54 - 730 with Sarah Ferguson. 30:35 - (WARNING: DISTRESSING VISION) Timeline of events as the attack unfolded. 37:44 - Bondi reeling the morning after the deadly attack. 44:36 - Australian government faces mounting criticism over antisemitism response. 50:04 - Prime Minister Anthony Albanese joins the program. 1:05:15 - Suspected gunman Naveed Akram known to ASIO. 1:11:09 - NSW Premier Chris Minns joins the program. 1:19:48 - Adam Harvey reports from Bondi Pavilion as sun sets on vigil. 1:24:46 - Goodbye from Sarah Ferguson.
